results.title: Tides of Fundy
results.brief_description: A fascinating study of the phenomenal tides in the Bay of Fundy on Canada’s Atlantic coast and how they affect the life of the region.

results.title: Tide pool life
results.brief_description: A study of some of the more usual species of marine life found near rocky shores and the tide pools. Mussels, whelks, sea anenomes, sea urchins and abalone are shown in some detail.

results.title: Tiddalik: based on an aboriginal legend
results.creator_credit: Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School and Pamela Abbey
results.brief_description: Based on an aboriginal legend, this animated film tells the story of Tiddalik, a greedy frog who drains the world of water, and the efforts of his fellow creatures to replenish the water supply.

results.title: Tidal vectors
results.brief_description: ‘Tidal Vectors’ is a 3D digital installation of the dynamic shape and motion of Sydney Harbour composed from scientific data of depth soundings and tidal flow vectors. Elements of marine geography and historical reference relating to the harbour are layered to create a poetic metaphor for Sydney and the broader Australian Culture.

results.title: Ticket, passport and tarot cards. Episode 18. The Star
results.brief_description: AIRED 29 December 2005 Based on a popular book from Tarot expert Linda Marson, this series is a a unique combination of personal diary, travel journal and Tarot imagery. Screened as a weekly show on Channel 31 in Melbourne, T, P and TC was a five minute filler program that screened from 1 September 2005 - 26 January 2006.

results.title: Ticket to Turkey
results.brief_description: A record of a train journey from London to Istanbul by Johnny Morris. On his trip through the continental capitals, he is seen watching an unorthodox fountain in Brussels, steaming blissfully down the Rhine, admiring a rebuiilt Nuremburg, pursuing the ghost of Harry Lime in Vienna in the rain, and visiting Budapest before embarking on a journey through Yugoslavia and Bulgaria. He continues to the Golden Horn and Istanbul where he explores the town and samples the pleasures of a Turkish holiday resort and a trip down the Bosphorus.

results.title: Tick tock: all about the clock
results.creator_credit: Rainbow Educational Video, David Boyd and Tom Wheeler
results.brief_description: This video investigates why it is important to know what time it is as well as how to tell the time! It shows how various types of clocks and watches aid in the understanding of what the numbers on a clock mean, the function of the clock hands, the meaning of seconds, minutes, half hours and hours. Children will see that different kinds of clocks and watches, such as the sundial, hour glass and stopwatch, all help to keep track of the time. They will also gain an understanding of how the eart spinning on its axis causes day and night. Suitable for Kindergarten and Lower Primary level students.

results.title: Tic tac 2 heelflip: Australia's skateboarding history
results.creator_credit: Stephen Hill, Whyte House Productions and Mike Hill
results.brief_description: The history of skateboarding in Australia is traced in this documentary from the period in the mid 1960’s when surfers used skating as a pastime between waves. A revival in the mid 1970’s through improved board and wheel technology and the influence of American skaters saw the formation of skateboard teams who perfected freestyle techniques. It was also during this time that some emerging gangs ventured into the vertical style. Later on, ramp competitions and extreme sports extravaganza occurred. Featuring Australia’s best skateboarders in interview, the history of Australian skateboarding is told through early home movie film footage and video, along with a couple of news report extracts. Also features footage from the classic skateboard short - “Skaterdater”.
